Summary: Remove "Description" specific to Firefox Bookmarks
Description: completely delete  description  from firefox bookmarks and bookmarks database  because it extremely wastes space in bookmarks database  which in end makes performance and speed of bookmarks exporting and importing very very slow and long  what s more it s not searchable and doesn t look like it s useful in any way  compared to tags or at least keywords     some website page for example   name   jak chronić dane przed utratą     pclab pl   location      html   description   od kilku lat jesteśmy świadkami gwałtownego rozwoju technologii it  tylko w ciągu ostatnich trzech lat podwoiła się liczba informacji zapisanych na różnych nośnikach  niewątpliwie przodują dyski magnetyczne    na których zapisane jest aż    danych  reszta informacji zamieszczana jest na płytach cd i dvd  pamięciach flash  dyskietkach i innych nośnikach  z zagadnieniem przechowywania  kumulowania ogromnej masy informacji na nośnikach  nierozerwalnie łączy się temat utraty danych  przyczyn jest wiele  generalnie wynikają one czy to z awarii sprzętu  czy też po prostu błędnego zachowania się użytkownika komputera  niniejszy artykuł będzie poświęcony właśnie problematyce utraty danych  a dokładniej co robić  a czego nie robić  gdy przytrafi się nam taki przypadek  będzie to pewnego rodzaju kompendium wiedzy i tak też chcielibyśmy  drogi czytelniku  abyś potraktował ten artykuł

Summary: Pref for fingerprinting resistance in private browsing mode
Description: proposal     i would like to propose a boolean pref   privacy resistfingerprinting pbm   when true  this pref would enable fingerprinting resistance in private browsing windows only   privacy resistfingerprinting pbm    true  all private browsing windows resist fingerprinting  all non pb windows do not    false    normal behavior     background     firefox currently has a boolean pref called  privacy resistfingerprinting   the fingerprinting resistance mechanism spoofs or hides numerous characteristics of the user s system from content pages  such as screen dimensions  installed fonts  etc   privacy resistfingerprinting has two values    true  all content pages resist fingerprinting   false    normal behavior     purpose     users expect private browsing windows should protect their privacy  according to a recent survey by duckduckgo          •     ±     believe that private browsing  prevents websites from tracking me     •     ±     believe that private browsing  prevents ads from tracking me        providing an option to enable fingerprinting resistance in private browsing windows will help to meet these user expectations  in the future    we might consider enabling the proposed pref by default

Description: created attachment   screenshot png  user agent  mozilla       gecko   firefox     build id     steps to reproduce   from bug        selecting  all cookies    of  cookies and site data  section in the privacy preferences     see  third party cookies  part of the  content blocking  section    actual results    third party cookies  part of the  content blocking  section is unchecked and  all cookies are currently blocked  warning is shown  this gives users that  all cookies are blocked  but why  third party cookies are not blocked    expected results   if selecting  all cookies  of  cookies and site data  section in the privacy preferences   third party cookies  and  all third party cookies    parts of the  content blocking  section shoud be checked

Summary: Migrate baseMenuOverlay.dtd to Fluent
Description: in an attempt to see what performance or other types of issues we may encounter when trying to move startup strings to fluent  i ve put together a patch that migrates basemenuoverlay dtd to fluent

Summary: firefox icon replaces favicon of a bookmark in location bar results, bookmarks sidebar
Description: created attachment   firefox icon in placeof favicon

Summary: Firefox window is always restored not maximized, also if it was maximized in the previous session
Description: the firefox window is always restored not maximized for me  also if i always maximize it in my sessions

Summary: Unenroll any enrolled pref experiments if the opt-out pref for normandy studies is set to false
Description: per bug   comment    seems like the pref should also govern pref experiments  not just add on studies

Summary: Please have all divider hairlines in hamburger menu door-hanger to be consistently aligned
Description: created attachment   screen shot       at       png  the divider hairline for sync accounts should be aligned to the divider line in  tracking protection   please see screenshot for reference  thanks

Summary: about:privatebrowsing uses hardcoded "Firefox" in its copy
Description: see   central source browser locales en us chrome browser aboutprivatebrowsing dtd

Summary: Policy: Disable history
Description: policy  disable history  places history enabled    this is already supported for privacy reasons  note that there s a visible checkbox for this in about preferences  so it should be handled

Summary: Set vertical padding on .popup-notification-button instead of a fixed min-height
Description: like in the bookmark panel   we should set vertical padding instead of a fixed min height as the latter would make the buttons look too spacious or squashed depending on the system font size        central rev   browser themes shared places editbookmarkpanel inc css

Summary: Mark HTTP page as insecure on address bar
Description: since now https pages are mainstream  we are surely to address http as insecure with some visual indicators

Summary: Show preference rollouts in about:support
Description: the list of currently active preference rollouts should be shown in about support  it should not include graduated or rolled back rollouts

Summary: Confirmation hint shouldn't animate the checkmark with toolkit.cosmeticAnimations.enabled = false
Description: new bookmark confirmation doesn t respect toolkit cosmeticanimations enabled preference in about config  str     open about config    set toolkit cosmeticanimations enabled preference to false and see that  saved to library   doorhanger panelui is animated

Summary: Problematic code in "init-store.js"
Description: came across this bug while implementing      looks like  adding properties to store   won t work as expected for redux middlewares  see more details  here     it didn t break the code due to the coincidence that     js store  didrehydrate   false  store  didrequestinitialstate   false      has the same effect as    js store  didrehydrate   undefined  store  didrequestinitialstate   undefined       we should fix this to avoid further bugs in the future

Summary: turning on linting of Activity-Stream code in mozilla-central
Description: after eslint gets vendored into mozilla central  we ll want to land our own specific eslint plugins there as well  so that we can then remove activity stream from the top level  eslintignore and have it get first class linting support in tree   there was some discussion about wanting in tree unit testing as a prerequisite  so that broad changes are less likely to introduce issues that should have been caught

Summary: Policy: Disable caching
Description: policy  disable caching  is this browser cache disk enabled

Summary: Upgrade dependency from react/react-dom 16.2.0
Description: split from bug   as this would require vendor directory changes and could impact actual runtime behavior  so avoiding late in cycle change for additional bake time

Summary: Show add-on studies in about:support
Description: the list of currently active add on studies should be shown in about support  it should not include expired studies  this data is technically already available in about support in list of installed add ons  but having it called out specifically seems like a good idea

Summary: Remove "tree" from the cookies preferences
Description: tree id  cookieslist   can be replaced with a listbox  collapsing cookies from the same website may not be needed  and we may just consider a command to delete all cookies from the same website as the selected one

Summary: Options in two sections of about:preferences#privacy are confusing
Description: there s a first part about cookies which also has an option about blocking third party content  then there s a second part at the bottom specifically about third party content blocking   it s unclear what the first option is blocking and what the second option is blocking

Summary: pre-render locales in mc using node script
Description: this will remove one of the biggest sources of build artifact noise in patches that we want to uplift

Summary: Delete from History doesn't work from topsites you just added
Description: add a topsite  try  delete from history     nothing happens try  dismiss     works  there don t seem to be any errors in the console

Summary: When changing the tab selection, there's a border between tabs that's painted slightly later
Description: i m seeing this intermittently on the tabswitch and tabclose performance tests now that i m adding flicker coverage to them in bug    this happens most frequently on windows

Summary: Set appropriate picker label for the shipping option picker based on shippingType
Description: the label for the  shipping option picker   should change based on the shippingtype property  for example  we should not have  shipping options  as the picker label when shippingtype is  delivery  or  pickup

Summary: Provide a way to lock updates on
Description: we focused on turning off updates   we should provide a policy to make sure a user can t turn off updates   see     templates issues

Summary: Ability to test filter expressions on users
Description: there should be a normandy action that simply pings telemetry to say that it was executed  this would help with estimating population size and uptake rates   this bug covers the client side changes needed for

Summary: Send an event that studies can receive when ending a add-on study
Description: originally from        this is in regards to mozilla shield studies addon utils    now that we are   moving towards web extensions  a potential solution is to broadcast a message    that tells the study that it s being disabled by normandy  as opposed to by the    user   this message can be caught by the shield utils

Summary: Add Preference Pane checkbox to control CFR Notifications
Description: let s add a control in the preferences to allow for control over if cfr recommendations are shown to the user

Summary: Ensure search shortcuts (token aliases) are properly supported in the View
Description: this is mostly about checking the situation once the other bugs involving search results are fixed

Summary: Update downloads.dtd and downloads.properties to downloads.ftl
Description: update downloads dtd  downloads properties and the files that use them to fluent file downloads ftl

Summary: Remove babel plugin for object rest spread when dependencies update
Description: right now we need a babel plugin for object rest spread syntax  i think when eslint updates to        we should be able to remove this

Summary: Don't bind "ctrlTab-preview" elements to "button-base"
Description: i believe ctrltab preview can be removed by just building the markup in browser ctrltab js

Summary: Enhance error message to handle failed unified bar search
Description: with unified bar we need to rethink the message we are showing    hmm  we re having trouble finding that site  we can t connect to the server at www date gettime  if that address is correct  here are three other things you can try        to something that helps users with these unruly search strings  may be something like    hmm  we re having trouble finding that site    did you mean to search date gettime   we can t connect to the server at www date gettime  if that address is correct  here are three other things you can try        where search date gettime is a link or button that queries   date gettime    as discussed in bug    creating ux enhancement bug to handle error messaging as suggested that caters to failed unified bar searches

Summary: AltGr+Enter does not open URL in new tab
Description: updated to   beta      in estonian and russian keyboard layout altgr enter does not open a url in a new tab anymore   this is a one more regression  as bug   is

Summary: Stop injecting about:preferences changes, just change the page
Description: currently  we dynamically inject changes into about preferences to create the  allow firefox to install and run studies  checkbox  this is complicated and problematic  it would be much easier to move this code into the preferences component directly  instead of dynamically injecting it

Summary: Consolidate browser.chrome.favicons and site_icons prefs
Description: bug   was originally filed for  favicons false not being honored  but it s actually because  site icons was not being honored  but bug   comment   suggests it could be cleaned up to keep just  favicons   at a quick glance  there s just a couple uses of each pref    central search q browser chrome favicons   central search q browser chrome site icons path

Summary: Discarded tab becomes blank when moved into a new window
Description: run this code in an extension with the  tabs  permission             let url            let  id  tabid    await browser tabs create       await browser windows create       let tab   await browser tabs get       console assert       await browser tabs remove           result    assertion failed  tab url  expected      got  about blank   expected  the assert passes

Summary: Remove "toolbar.xml" from Toolkit
Description: the remaining bindings in  toolbar xml  in toolkit are used only by one test file on mac  but they are still referenced on windows and linux

Summary: Auto-format code using prettier?
Description: from   stream issues    prettier is pretty awesome  seems pretty trivial to add  but we may want to relax remove some eslint rules in order to make it work better w  linting   npm i prettier latest  d echo system addon vendor    prettierignore    prettier    js    bin loaders system addon        js jsm jsx json scss     no bracket spacing   write  we could also use prettier as an eslint config and or plugin  or use something like prettier eslint instead  which does a prettier then eslint   fix

Summary: Add telemetry probe for browser.contentblocking.enabled
Description: we already track the values of the tracking protection prefs in telemetry     central rev   toolkit components telemetry histograms json      should we add a probe for the new content blocking pref too

Summary: Migrate top sites, search strings from newtab.properties to newtab.ftl
Description: in this ticket  we will migrate strings from newtab properties to a new newtab ftl  note that this will require changes to our build system in github to point to the right strings in mc

Summary: Create a talos test for loading Preferences
Description: there is currently no test measuring the startup of preferences  while a lot of work is going on and much more is planned      performance optimizations     de xblification     move to fluent   myk wrote   measure prefs central for his work  not sure if it s enough or how such test should look like  but i d definitely benefit from having a test like this to verify that i m not regressing with my work on fluent in prefs

Summary: Remove feedIcon PNGs in favor of feed.svg
Description: central search q feedicon case false regexp false path   the jar mn references   the files themselves can be removed   the other references   can be replaced with chrome   browser skin feed svg

Summary: Migrate sections strings from newtab.properties to newtab.ftl
Description: in this ticket  we will migrate strings from newtab properties to a new newtab ftl  note that this will require changes to our build system in github to point to the right strings in mc

Summary: Extensions Delete policy should happen at every startup
Description: we should make the extensions delete policy happen at every startup until we have blacklist whitelist of policies

Summary: Sync should re-fetch history collection after places restore.
Description: due to a mishap involving a poorly written shell command  i accidentally deleted  places sqlite      places was able to restore it  but since places doesn t back up history  my history was entirely gone  syncing didn t restore it until i opened a console and manually called resetclient  on the history engine   this might be a regression from bug    a bug we ve always had  or intentional behavior    either way  i think we could do better here with only a little effort

Summary: want Tracking Protection without sending Do Not Track signal
Description: in edit   preferences   privacy   security   tracking protection  please add an option to have tracking protection on without sending a do not track signal  my understanding is that some websites abuse that signal by tracking us precisely because we sent the signal and therefore must have something valuable they want  the only way now available to not send the signal is to never have tracking protection on   i m using ff         fedora       on a fedora   linux platform kept virtually evergreen

Summary: Consider whether we need to keep the page action histogram telemetry (was: "Invalid string label" error in console when pinning a tab from Page Action menu)
Description: the error is coming from mozilla central toolkit components telemetry core telemetryhistogram cpp   i am pretty sure that it s because  pintab  wasn t added to the accepted  labels  for fx page action   events in mozilla central toolkit components telemetry histograms json  all those events expired in firefox    so i was told they aren t collected anymore and i didn t have to add  pintab  to the  labels  list   so    i think this is a harmless error  but filing it anyway before somebody else does

Summary: Url for "Manage devices" in Lockwise section of protection report should match any custom FxA for Sync
Description: i understand lockwise doesn t work with custom self hosted fxa sync yet  i still believe the  manage devices  link introduced in bug   should be updated with  fxaccounts config promisemanagedevicesuri  to reflect the current fxa sync services the user is syncing with

Summary: plus and scroll tabs right overlap for small window with many pinned tabs
Description: created attachment   overlap png  plus and scroll tabs right overlap for small window with many tabs  see attachment  i never saw this before

Summary: Resist Fingerprinting (RFP) breaks dark mode in about:logins (*pages)
Description: currently lockwise s about logins is not adhering to os browser dark theme

Summary: When creating a new pref, it is not discover-able how to create it.
Description: it is bad ui

Summary: Remove addon-progress-notification binding
Description: this one contains logic only  it could be moved to a simple js module     central source browser base content urlbarbindings xml

Description: reliably reproduced with a new profile in beta   on windows  but not nightly     see

Summary: Sync default permission settings
Description: syncing permissions is more involved    but the default permission settings  like  block new requests asking to  access your location  access your camera  allow notifications   are controlled by  permissions default    prefixed prefs   these would be easy to add to our list of synced prefs  though it might surprise folks that we sync the global settings  but not per site settings or exceptions

Summary: UI tooltip and doorhanger show incorrect CA after CA change
Description: the ui lock tooltip and doorhanger show the incorrect ca after a ca change and page reload   reproduce thusly      create three fake ca certificates  say  fake ca     etc     create a page   on a webserver that can serve https     create a dns name for this site  say  foosite      create three site certs for cn foosite  one signed by fake ca    one signed by fake ca    etc     import the certs for fake ca   and fake ca   into ff  trust the certs to identify websites  do not import the cert for fake ca       setup the webserver for foosite to serve the foosite cert that s signed by fake ca       visit foosite in ff and notice that the tooltip and doorhanger say  verified by  fake ca        now shutdown the webserver and set it up to to serve the foosite cert that s signed by fake ca         reload foosite in ff and notice that the tooltip and doorhanger  still  say  verified by  fake ca        click  more information  and notice that website identity   verified by says  fake ca     as does the window got by clicking  view certificate      shutdown the webserver and set it up to to serve the foosite cert that s signed by fake ca         reload foosite in ff  notice the warning  and wipe your forehead

Summary: Empty redirects for blocked resources (like uBlock Origin)
Description: i was looking at the ublock origin wiki and they seem to have a really interesting creative feature for resources that are known to break sites when they are blocked     library empty redirect resources  basically  they package sanitized versions of resources that are to be blocked  including resources like   google analytics com ga js ↪ google analytics com analytics js ↪ google analytics com inpage linkid js ↪ google analytics com cx api js ↪ googletagservices com gpt js ↪ googletagmanager com gtm js ↪   that appear on the disconnect list  and they mislead pages into thinking that the genuine tracker script has been served    this may be a great way to prevent pages from breaking when tp goes to default on  and i didn t see any tickets open for it

Summary: Authenticate OAuth-related requests with sessionToken, not assertions
Description: when firefox wants to perform an oauth related service request  it currently uses a browserid assertion to authenticate itself to the oauth server api   i found two places where is does this  one here when  making a new oauth access token              let assertion   await this getassertion         let result   await client gettokenfromassertion       and one here when  authorizing a new oauth client connection              const assertion   await this getassertion         return client authorizecodefromassertion        recent versions of the fxa server allow oauth requests to be directly authenticated with a  sessiontoken  rather than indirecting through a browserid assertion  one day we hope to be able to deprecate browserid assertions entirely  so it would be useful to move desktop away from using them where possible   let s update  fxaccountsoauthgrantclient  so that      gettokenfromassertion  becomes  getaccesstokenfromsessiontoken   and calls      oauth token    using a  sessiontoken  rather than the current endpoint using a browserid assertion     authorizecodefromassertion  becomes  authorizecodefromsessiontoken   and calls      oauth authorization    using a  sessiontoken  rather than the current endpoint using a browserid assertion

Description: str     go to    i tried this in a private window  but i don t believe the bug is specific to private windows   at this point  the content blocking log looks like this        js await gbrowser selectedbrowser getcontentblockinglog                  true                    true                    true                    true          true          true                    true                    true          true          true                    true          true          true                    true          true          true                    true          true          true                  click on  continue with google    this will activate our automatic storage access grant heuristic   at this point our content blocking log looks like      js await gbrowser selectedbrowser getcontentblockinglog                  true                    true                    true                    true          true          true                    true                    true          true          true                    true          true          true                    true          true          true          false             true                    true          true          true               note the newly added      false         entry for  accounts google com    that is the newly added content blocking log entry that is being mishandled here      now open the protections panel and open cookies under it   actual results      has a  x blocked  label next to it   expected results      must have a  x allowed  label next to it   reloading the page at this point will make the bug go away   we used to have this same bug in the  browser contentblocking js  code before  so i suspect that we probably have a logic bug similar to that one

Summary: Leaving Pioneer - modal and cleanup
Description: wireframes    page   screen id    annotation id       as an enrolled pioneer user  i want to leave the pioneer program  so that i m no longer contributing data       user sees a  leave  button because they are already enrolled in pioneer     the pioneer main program copy tells the user that we will mark their data for deletion when they leave pioneer     onclick  leave   show a confirmation modal   telling them that we will delete their data and will not be able to use it for public good        if the user continues and  leaves   we revert their state to no longer a member of pioneer and trigger a data deletion      for leaving pioneer  we delete all pioneer panel data and data for all open studies       we uninstall core panel add on and all study add ons  clean up and take the trash out      pioneer icon removed from firefox toolbar     onclick  cancel   close the modal  no deletion  no disenrollment  the user remains in pioneer

Summary: See if the providers manager or provider base class can manage query lifetimes instead of having every provider subclass do it
Description: every provider subclass does something like this      js class providersubclass     constructor           maps the running queries by querycontext      this queries   new map         async startquery        let instance           this queries set               this queries delete         cancelquery        this queries delete              it s not a big deal  but it would be nice if the providers manager or provider base class could take care of managing the lifetime of  this queries  and its contents  then subclasses would only need to access  this queries  after they do something async   we could even abstract that away so that subclasses could call a method like  this querystillactive   after an async operation  that method would be implemented in the base class of course

Summary: Default per-user context install folder should be the same as recommended on Windows documentation
Description: user agent  mozilla       gecko   firefox      steps to reproduce   when installing firefox without administrator privileges  the setup program defaults to   localappdata  mozilla firefox  folder     expected results   however     us windows   msi installation context folder redirection  states that windows installer     redirects the programfiles and   folders from  programfiles  or  programfiles   to  localappdata  programs   it would be nice if when we try to install firefox without using admin privileges the installation program defaulted to   localappdata  programs mozilla firefox  so to follow windows installer s standard  even if the setup program is nsis based

Summary: Investigate reports of misalignment in the new download progress indicator
Description: there have been some reports that the filled progress disc is not centered inside the outer ring in the new download button progress indicator    one example     firefox nightly proton has got an update that   this progress indicator is composed of an outer element   downloads indicator progress outer  which is simply a  border radius      and   solid border color to draw the ring  and an inner element    downloads indicator progress inner  which is also border radius     and a  conic gradient  background to render the progressive pie slice states    see    central source browser themes shared downloads indicator inc css      we should figure out what platforms settings conditions this reproduces on  and what options exist to fix it

Summary: On Linux, privacy.resistfingerprinting interferes with about:newtab dark mode styling
Description: using privacy resistfingerprinting appears to interfere with dark theme styling using a gtk dark theme on some system pages    as well as extension tooltips    i imagine that by design resistfingerprinting is supposed to prevent sending theming information to websites  however it shouldn t really work like that on system pages  it is probably something that depends on the referenced bug which used to affect all linux users  if i disable privacy resistfingerprinting  dark mode on about newtab works properly
